Uses of Interface
option.Option

  • Packages that use Option 
    Package Description
    option  
    result  

    • Uses of Option in option

      Subinterfaces of Option in option 
      Modifier and Type Interface Description
      interface  ForwardingOption<T>
      ForwardingOption is a utility interface that functions as a wrapper around any given Option and delegates calls to the inner Option.
      Classes in option that implement Option 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      class  None<T>  
      class  Some<T>  
      Methods in option that return Option 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      default <R> Option<R> Option.and​(Option<R> other)
      Returns the first Option if it is None, otherwise it returns Some
      default <R> Option<R> Option.andThen​(Function<? super T,​? extends Option<R>> func)
      Alias for flatMap
      default Option<T> Option.filter​(Predicate<T> p)
      Returns Some if an object is present and it passes the predicate, otherwise it returns None.
      default <R> Option<R> ForwardingOption.flatMap​(Function<? super T,​? extends Option<R>> func)  
      <R> Option<R> None.flatMap​(Function<? super T,​? extends Option<R>> func)  
      <R> Option<R> Option.flatMap​(Function<? super T,​? extends Option<R>> func)
      Given a function which takes an instance of type T as input, if the object is Some, this method will return the result of applying that method to the inner object.
      <R> Option<R> Some.flatMap​(Function<? super T,​? extends Option<R>> func)  
      default <R> Option<R> Option.flatten()
      Flattens any nested Options.
      static <T> Option<T> Option.from​(Optional<T> optional)
      A utility-function to convert a Optional to an instance of this type.
      default Option<T> Option.ifNone​(Option.Action onNone)
      Evaluates the Action if the Option is None.
      default Option<T> Option.ifSome​(Consumer<? super T> onSome)
      On Some-variants, this method passes the inner object to the passed function.
      Option<T> ForwardingOption.inner()  
      default <R> Option<R> Option.map​(Function<? super T,​? extends R> func)
      Applies the function to the inner object if present and returns a new Option containing the result.
      default Option<T> Option.or​(Option<T> other)
      Returns the first option if it is Some, and the second Option, if the first is None.
      default Option<T> ForwardingOption.orElse​(Supplier<? extends Option<T>> other)  
      Option<T> None.orElse​(Supplier<? extends Option<T>> other)  
      Option<T> Option.orElse​(Supplier<? extends Option<T>> other)
      The None-counterpart to flatMap.
      Option<T> Some.orElse​(Supplier<? extends Option<T>> other)  
      default Option<T> Option.xor​(Option<T> other)
      If only one Option is Some, it returns Some, otherwise it returns None.
      Methods in option that return types with arguments of type Option 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      static <T> Collector<Option<T>,​List<Option<T>>,​Option<List<T>>> Option.andCollector()
      This collector converts a List<Option<T>> into an Option<List<T>>.
      static <T> Collector<Option<T>,​List<Option<T>>,​Option<List<T>>> Option.andCollector()
      This collector converts a List<Option<T>> into an Option<List<T>>.
      static <T> Collector<Option<T>,​List<Option<T>>,​Option<List<T>>> Option.andCollector()
      This collector converts a List<Option<T>> into an Option<List<T>>.
      static <T> Collector<Option<T>,​List<T>,​Option<List<T>>> Option.orCollector()
      This collector takes a List<Option<T>> and converts it to an Option<List<T>>, If any objects are present, this returns a Some with a List containing all objects, otherwise it returns None
      static <T> Collector<Option<T>,​List<T>,​Option<List<T>>> Option.orCollector()
      This collector takes a List<Option<T>> and converts it to an Option<List<T>>, If any objects are present, this returns a Some with a List containing all objects, otherwise it returns None
      Methods in option with parameters of type Option 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      default <R> Option<R> Option.and​(Option<R> other)
      Returns the first Option if it is None, otherwise it returns Some
      default Option<T> Option.or​(Option<T> other)
      Returns the first option if it is Some, and the second Option, if the first is None.
      default Option<T> Option.xor​(Option<T> other)
      If only one Option is Some, it returns Some, otherwise it returns None.
